snippet.title: Fathers' Day Tech Gift Guide
snippet.description: Forget the neckties and wristwatches, and get the fathers in your life the tech they really want. Yo

snippet.title: Best laptops
snippet.description: CNET editors choose and review the best thin and light laptops, notebooks, and ultrabooks.

snippet.title: Quick Mac prank for April Fools' Day
snippet.description: Looking to prank a friend today? Here is a quick and easy trick to throw their way.

snippet.title: Cats all the rage for April Fools' Day jokes
snippet.description: Both Google and Opera reveal cat-themed April Fools' Day jokes, with the former offering a QWERTY keyboard for felines and the latter showing off a cat-friendly browser.

snippet.title: How YouTube has made April Fools' Day foolish
snippet.description: It seems that, all year round, companies and individuals are trying to play jokes on the outside world, to get YouTube views and retweets. Doesn't this make April Fools' Day pointless?

snippet.title: EA apologizes for April Fools' prank gone bad
snippet.description: Electronic Arts apologizes for a tweet that jokingly claimed its game engine, Frostbite, was headed to Nintendo's Wii U.

snippet.title: Google automates David Hasselhoff photobombs for April Fools'
snippet.description: Thanks to a Google joke, your celebrity photobomb dreams are inching closer to reality. So long as you only dream about David Hasselhoff.

snippet.title: The best (and worst) automotive April Fools' announcements
snippet.description: Everyone's a comedian on April 1st, even your favorite automaker.

snippet.title: Google's April Fools' prank puts Pokemon in the real world
snippet.description: The search giant's latest addition to its Maps smartphone app includes 150 "catchable" Pokemon, part of a hoax we can only hope foreshadows augmented reality uses down the line.

snippet.title: Google introduces the shelfie (for fools)
snippet.description: Because Google just loves April Fools' pranks and you just love selfies. So here are shareable selfies for your Gmail account. Why did it take so long?
